item.title: Untangling The Mystery Of Why Shoelaces Come Untied
item.description: April 17, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Berkeley have figured out why shoelaces seem to come untied at the worst moments, like when you're running.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Berkeley have figured out why shoelaces seem to come untied at the worst moments, like when you're running. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/17/523636317/untangling-the-mystery-of-why-shoelaces-come-untied

item.title: 'Powwow Sweat' Promotes Fitness Through Traditional Dance
item.description: April 17, 2017 - Native Americans are 60 percent more likely to be obese than non-Hispanic whites. The Coeur D'Alene Tribe in Idaho is using traditional dance to get fit and lose weight. They call it "Powwow Sweat."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - Native Americans are 60 percent more likely to be obese than non-Hispanic whites. The Coeur D'Alene Tribe in Idaho is using traditional dance to get fit and lose weight. They call it "Powwow Sweat." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/17/522994311/powwow-sweat-promotes-fitness-through-traditional-dance

item.title: 'When I Was Your Age' And Other Pitfalls Of Talking To Teens About Stress
item.description: April 16, 2017 - Helping teenagers develop cognitive empathy, the ability to understand another person's perspective, can allow them to cope with stress better. But whether they accept help can be all in the phrasing.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 16, 2017 - Helping teenagers develop cognitive empathy, the ability to understand another person's perspective, can allow them to cope with stress better. But whether they accept help can be all in the phrasing. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/16/523592625/-when-i-was-your-age-and-other-conversational-pitfalls-of-talking-to-teens

item.title: Artist Sets Futuristic Dinner Party In World Reshaped By Rising Seas
item.description: April 16, 2017 - How will our diets shift as climate change causes sea-level rise and coastal flooding? Photographer Allie Wist attempts to answer that with pictures of an imagined "post-sea-level-rise dinner party."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 16, 2017 - How will our diets shift as climate change causes sea-level rise and coastal flooding? Photographer Allie Wist attempts to answer that with pictures of an imagined "post-sea-level-rise dinner party." http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/16/520294246/artist-sets-futuristic-dinner-party-in-world-reshaped-by-rising-seas

item.title: The Poetic Intimacy Of Administering Anesthesia
item.description: April 16, 2017 - An anesthesiologist and poet says her medical work is well-suited to poetry, as patients move in and out of consciousness under the doctor's watch.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 16, 2017 - An anesthesiologist and poet says her medical work is well-suited to poetry, as patients move in and out of consciousness under the doctor's watch. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/16/523816317/the-poetic-intimacy-of-administering-anesthesia

item.title: U.S. Health Care Wrestles With The 'Pre-Existing Condition'
item.description: April 15, 2017 - Insurers and politicians struggle constantly to thread the needle between making sure people have good health insurance and figuring out who should pay, especially for those who need a lot of care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 15, 2017 - Insurers and politicians struggle constantly to thread the needle between making sure people have good health insurance and figuring out who should pay, especially for those who need a lot of care. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/15/523577871/u-s-health-care-wrestles-with-the-pre-existing-condition

item.title: Tax Day And Health Insurance Under Trump
item.description: April 15, 2017 - To avoid penalties, people who didn't have health insurance in 2016 or who got federal assistance to pay the premiums need to take a little extra care when completing their tax forms this year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 15, 2017 - To avoid penalties, people who didn't have health insurance in 2016 or who got federal assistance to pay the premiums need to take a little extra care when completing their tax forms this year. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/15/523968089/tax-day-and-health-insurance-under-trump

item.title: Trespass, Jail, Repeat: How One Man Has Spent 575 Days in Jail
item.description: April 15, 2017 - Michael Treadwell has schizophrenia and a drinking problem. He cycles in and out of jail on minor charges like public urination. It costs taxpayers major money, and he's not the only one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 15, 2017 - Michael Treadwell has schizophrenia and a drinking problem. He cycles in and out of jail on minor charges like public urination. It costs taxpayers major money, and he's not the only one. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/15/518692463/trespass-jail-repeat-how-one-man-has-spent-575-days-in-jail

item.title: Trump Signs Bill That Allows States To Deny Funding To Planned Parenthood
item.description: April 14, 2017 - Earlier this week, President Trump signed a bill that could encourage states to withhold federal money from Planned Parenthood. Opponents say it will have a big impact on women's health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - Earlier this week, President Trump signed a bill that could encourage states to withhold federal money from Planned Parenthood. Opponents say it will have a big impact on women's health. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/14/523997009/trump-signs-bill-that-allows-states-to-deny-funding-to-planned-parenthood

item.title: How A Budget Squeeze Can Lead To Sloppy Science And Even Cheating
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The hypercompetitive world of biomedical research occasionally drives scientists to cheat. More often, scientists make decisions that undercut their results. That can lead colleagues astray.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The hypercompetitive world of biomedical research occasionally drives scientists to cheat. More often, scientists make decisions that undercut their results. That can lead colleagues astray. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/14/523786179/how-a-budget-squeeze-can-lead-to-sloppy-science-and-even-cheating

item.title: A Family Of Ebola Fighters: 'With God's Help, We Made It'
item.description: April 14, 2017 - It's the third anniversary of the Ebola pandemic; 2014 was a catastrophic year. But one family in Liberia gave health workers a reason to celebrate.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - It's the third anniversary of the Ebola pandemic; 2014 was a catastrophic year. But one family in Liberia gave health workers a reason to celebrate. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/14/523437067/a-family-of-ebola-fighters-with-gods-help-we-made-it

item.title: Michigan Doctor Charged With Performing Female Genital Mutilation On Girls
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The Department of Justice says it believes this is the first case brought under a federal law that criminalizes the practice, which is widely condemned as a human rights violation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The Department of Justice says it believes this is the first case brought under a federal law that criminalizes the practice, which is widely condemned as a human rights violation. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/14/523917425/michigan-doctor-charged-with-performing-female-genital-mutilation-on-girls

item.title: Navy Tells Sailors To Leave The E-Cigarette On Shore
item.description: April 14, 2017 - At least 15 "mishaps" have resulted in injuries or damage, the Navy says. The new policy bans the devices on ships, submarines, aircraft, boats, craft and heavy equipment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - At least 15 "mishaps" have resulted in injuries or damage, the Navy says. The new policy bans the devices on ships, submarines, aircraft, boats, craft and heavy equipment. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/14/523296216/navy-tells-sailors-to-leave-the-e-cigarette-on-shore

item.title: Maps Show A Dramatic Rise In Health Insurance Coverage Under ACA
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The overall increase in the number of Americans with health insurance draws attention to counties where the uninsured rate is still high, many of them in states that chose not to expand Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The overall increase in the number of Americans with health insurance draws attention to counties where the uninsured rate is still high, many of them in states that chose not to expand Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/14/522956939/maps-show-a-dramatic-rise-health-in-insurance-coverage-under-aca

item.title: Is Yellow Fever Knocking At Our Door?
item.description:
April 14, 2017 - An outbreak in Brazil isn't slowing down as predicted. Dr. Anthony Fauci calls it "a potential threat" to the U.S.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/14/523312856/is-yellow-fever-knocking-at-our-door
